# Load necessary library
library(tidyr)

# Create the initial data frame with plant heights at the start and end of the experiment
df <- data.frame(
  plant = c("plant 1", "plant 2", "plant 3", "plant 4", "plant 5"),
  start_experiment = c(12.0, 15.5, 10.2, 13.5, 14.8),
  end_experiment = c(14.0, 16.2, 9.5, 14.0, 15.3)
)

# Reshape the data frame to have the height in one column and the time of the measurement as a factor
df_melted <- gather(df, key = "time", value = "height", start_experiment, end_experiment)
df_melted$time <- factor(df_melted$time)

# Create the growth list
row_names <- rownames(df)
initial_heights <- df$start_experiment
final_heights <- df$end_experiment

# Calculate the percentage change in height for each plant
growth_percentage <- ((final_heights - initial_heights) / initial_heights) * 100

# Create a table with plants and their corresponding growth
growth_table <- data.frame(
  plant = df$plant,
  growth = growth_percentage
)

# Create the 'my.experiment' list
my.experiment <- list(
  data = df_melted,
  growth = list(
    plants = row_names,
    growth_percentage = growth_percentage,
    growth_table = growth_table
  ),
  message = "The plants showed varying growth, with some increasing and others decreasing in height."
)

# Print the results
print(my.experiment)
